title: Virtualization Process Design and Satisfaction Improvement for Online Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of elementary scientific terminology and basic smartphone usage skills
context.additional_context: A science education program conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners design an online science learning module by utilizing the five core elements of the Personal Virtual Theory (PVT) of learning: sensory needs, relational needs, expression, accessibility, and relevance.
Learners achieve over 80% satisfaction by converting science concepts into visual and interactive representations (animations, quizzes, simulations) in a mobile environment.
Learners apply the online learning module designed through project-based assessment to a real educational setting and reflect over 75% sustained usage intention.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
